greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n = Product (p_j^k_j) then a(n) = Sum partition(k_j).
comment: a(n) is a function of the prime signature of n (cf. A025487). - _Matthew Vandermast_, Jun 24 2012
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537 (first 10000 terms from Vincenzo Librandi)
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: Additive with a(p^e) = A000041(e); a(n) = A007814(A318312(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 30 2018
mathematica: Prepend[ Array[ Plus @@ (PartitionsP /@ Last[ Transpose[ FactorInteger[ # ] ] ])&, 100, 2 ], 0 ]
Array[Total[PartitionsP /@ FactorInteger[#][[All, -1]] - Boole[# == 1]] &, 87] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 02 2018 *)
xref: Differs from A318473 for the first time at n=32, where a(32)=7, while A318473(32)=8.
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
ext: Term a(1) corrected from 1 to 0 (for an empty sum) by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 30 2018
